Institution: Boston College Law School
Center Name: Boston College Program on Innovation and Entrepreneurship
Notes from Grunin Team: Launched in 2017, PIE harnesses faculty expertise and student energy to explore legal issues across IP, business law, tech, biotech, and social impact sectors.

Institution: Columbia Law School (in conjunction with Columbia Climate School)
Center Name: Columbia Center on Sustainable Investment

Institution: Georgetown University Law Center
Center Name: Georgetown Denny Center for Democratic Capitalism
Notes from Grunin Team: The Center exists to reconcile the benefits of free market capitalism with the values and expectations of a democratic society. Its primary work is to evaluate the relative balance of economic performance and societal health and stability.

Institution: Albany Law School
Center Name: Innovation and Entrepreneurship
Notes from Grunin Team: Through this program, students can take interdisciplinary classes with students and faculty from area schools, can engage with exciting internship opportunities in area firms and institutions active in the intellectual property field, and can partner with students and faculty from other institutions in business plan competitions.

Institution: Arizona State University--Sandra Day O'Connor College of Law
Center Name: Law and Sustainability
Notes from Grunin Team: Law and Sustainability at ASU Law is a hub of innovative research, thought leadership and collaborative problem-solving for environmental sustainability issues.

Institution: Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law, Yeshiva University
Center Name: The Samuel & Ronnie Heyman Center on Corporate Governance
Notes from Grunin Team: The Samuel & Ronnie Heyman Center on Corporate Governance serves as a hub for research on innovation in business and corporate law.

Institution: Brooklyn Law School
Center Name: CUBE: The Center for Urban Business Entrepreneurship
Notes from Grunin Team: CUBE offers global opportunities for students to work with businesses, startups, and social entrepreneurs; consultation sessions with small businesses in Brooklyn; networking events; and programs including the CUBE Innovators Competition.

Institution: Duke University School of Law
Center Name: Duke Law & Entrepreneurship Program
Notes from Grunin Team: This Program integrates coursework, real-world experiences, and networking opportunities to grant students the specialized legal knowledge and professional skills you need in order to counsel leaders in the innovation economy.

Institution: Elisabeth Haub School of Law at Pace University
Center Name: Sustainable Business Law Hub | Pace University New York
Notes from Grunin Team: The Sustainable Business Law Hub serves as an incubator space, student-training program, research endeavor, and think tank devoted to addressing global sustainability challenges through policy and research projects, relationships with the business community, and capacity building in private environmental governance.

Institution: Yale Law School
Center Name: The Yale Center for Environmental Law & Policy (YCELP)
Notes from Grunin Team: YCELP is run jointly by the Yale School of Environmental Studies and the Yale Law School and focuses on the critical role played by the corporate sector in advancing sustainability.

Institution: New York Law School
Center Name: Wilf Impact Center for Public Interest Law
Notes from Grunin Team: The Center concerns itself with a broad range of topics (from anti-discrimination law to education law), including social entrepreneurship.

Institution: Northeastern University School of Law
Center Name: Program on the Corporation, Law and Global Society
Notes from Grunin Team: The Program aims to improve understanding of the role and limits of corporate law in the current global governance regime and to encourage new regulatory strategies for shaping the corporation and its institutional effects to contribute to a more just, equitable and accountable global order.

Institution: Touro University Jacob D. Fuchberg Law Center
Center Name: Land Use and Sustainable Development Law Institute
Notes from Grunin Team: The Institute focuses on land use and sustainable development law on Long Island. It is dedicated to educating and training future and current land use and sustainable development law practitioners and decision-makers

Institution: University of Arkansas School of Law
Center Name: Entrepreneurial Law Project (ELP)
Notes from Grunin Team: The Project, a collaboration between the University of Arkansas School of Law and the Office of Entrepreneurship & Innovation, provides free access to legal education and programming for Arkansas-based entrepreneurs.

Institution: University of California, Davis School of Law (King Hall)
Center Name: Center for Innovation, Law, and Society
Notes from Grunin Team: The Center broadly explores the legal and social implications of innovation, science, and technology.

Institution: University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA) School of Law
Center Name: Lowell Milken Institute for Business Law and Policy
Notes from Grunin Team: The Institute offers an array of courses, simulations, special programs and connected community support to develop attorneys ready to practice in fields including bankruptcy, corporate governance, international business, securities and tax.

Institution: UC Law San Francisco (formerly Hastings)
Center Name: Center for Innovation (C4i)
Notes from Grunin Team: C4i is an "action tank" (rather than think tank) invested in identifying implementable solutions to today’s problems, specifically problems surrounding medicine, startups, and AI.

Institution: University of La Verne College of Law
Center Name: Randall Lewis Center for Entrepreneurship, Innovation and Social Impact
Notes from Grunin Team: The Center provides students and legal practitioners resources on innovation, entrepreneurship, and social impact

Institution: University of Missouri--Kansas City School of Law
Center Name: Center for Law, Entrepreneurship & Innovation
Notes from Grunin Team: The Center is committed to leveraging the power of law and collaborative efforts across educational disciplines, and among multiple organizations, to nurture entrepreneurs and drive innovation towards a more prosperous and equitable future.

Institution: University of Missouri--Kansas City School of Law
Center Name: Regnier Institute for Entrepreneurship & Innovation (cross-campus partnership)
Notes from Grunin Team: The Center offers formal entrepreneurship education to enrolled UMKC students and provides educational opportunities for members of the community who are looking for guidance and support as they prepare to launch new ventures.

Institution: University of Oklahoma College of Law
Center Name: Entrepreneurial Law Center
Notes from Grunin Team: Launched in 2023, this Center addresses critical business and legal support needs for entrepreneurs and small businesses.

Institution: University of San Francisco School of Law
Center Name: Center for Law, Tech, and Social Good
Notes from Grunin Team: Formerly the Blockchain Law for Social Good Center, the Center for Law, Tech, and Social Good is an academic center and training ground for the next generation of lawyers, lawmakers and policy-enforcers to think about technology, society, and the law in a balanced way.

Institution: University of Tennessee College of Law
Center Name: Clayton Center for Entrepreneurial Law
Notes from Grunin Team: The Clayton Center provides a variety of real-world experiences for students pursuing a business law focus, including research associateships and field placement opportunities with Oak Ridge National Laboratory and the Y-12 National Security Complex, among others.

Institution: Widener University Commonwealth Law School
Center Name: Business Law Advising Program
Notes from Grunin Team: This Program helps advise small and midsize busineees as well as new entrepreneurs but does not mention social entrepreneurship

Institution: Pepperdine Caruso School of Law
Center Name: Palmer Center for Entrepreneurship and the Law
Notes from Grunin Team: The Palmer Center sponsors the SEER (Socially, Environmentally, and Ethically Responsible) Symposium, and they offer a certificate program that has a social entrepreneurship course elective option.

Institution: Syracuse University College of Law
Center Name: Property, Citizenship, and Social Entrepreneurism
Notes from Grunin Team: The Center on Property, Citizenship, and Social Entrepreneurism “explores the role of law in promoting the equitable and sustainable use of property to support vibrant communities and democratic citizenship.”

Institution: The Catholic University of America, Columbus School of Law
Center Name: Compliance, Investigations, and Corporate Responsibility Program (CICR)
Notes from Grunin Team: This Program offers an "opportunity for students to gain the skills necessary to work in the compliance and sustainability fields and to enhance the transparency, responsibility, and sustainability of organizations in the United States and around the world."

Institution: Vermont Law and Graduate School
Center Name: Environmental Law Center
Notes from Grunin Team: The Environmental Law Center (ELC) oversees the most comprehensive graduate environmental law program in the country. Consistently ranked among the nation’s best by U.S. News & World Report, this environmental law program includes six legal clinics, seven centers and institutes, 60+ environmental law courses, and 76 environmental faculty.

Institution: Northwestern Pritzker School of Law
Center Name: Donald Pritzker Entrepreneurship Law Center
Notes from Grunin Team: The DPELC, "originally founded as the Small Business Opportunity Center more than 20 years ago, is one of the first comprehensive programs in the United States to provide intensive, hands-on training for students who want to be transactional lawyers or founders of start-up companies."

Institution: New York University School of Law
Center Name: Grunin Center for Law and Social Entrepreneurship
Notes from Grunin Team: "Launched in 2017, the Grunin Center for Law and Social Entrepreneurship is a global leader in the field of law and social entrepreneurship."

Institution: Howard University School of Law
Center Name: ESG and Law Institute
Notes from Grunin Team: The only evidence I've found of this Institute is a 2022 article, however, there is no webpage for this program on the Howard University website.
